channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Italy’s Prime Minister Visits Trump in Mar-a-Lago
item.description: Giorgia Meloni, the Italian prime minister, joins just a handful of other world leaders who have been to the president-elect’s Florida estate since hi...

item.title: Jeff Baena, Film Director and Husband of Aubrey Plaza, Dies at 47
item.description: Mr. Baena, who was married to the actress Aubrey Plaza, co-wrote the existential comedy “I Heart Huckabees,” and wrote and directed films including “L...

item.title: Italy’s Prime Minister Visits Trump in Mar-a-Lago
item.description: Giorgia Meloni, the Italian prime minister, joins just a handful of other world leaders who have been to the president-elect’s Florida estate since hi...

item.title: Congestion Pricing Shows the Future of the Democratic Party
item.description: A model for how to deliver for voters without getting stuck in a traffic jam — political or otherwise.

item.title: NYC congestion pricing set to take effect after years of delays
item.description: Drivers entering parts of Manhattan will be charged $9 during peak hours in a program that aims to reduce the worst traffic in the world.

item.title: John Bolton: For Donald Trump, the Only Loyalty Is Fealty
item.description: Neither kings nor presidents, nor their countries, are well served if they are surrounded by sycophants and rent-seekers.

item.title: Powerful Winter Storm Brings Wind and Snow to Middle of the U.S.
item.description: An icy 18-mile section of Interstate 70 in Kansas was closed on Saturday. A large winter storm is bringing sleet, snow and freezing rain that will str...

item.title: Investors are like ‘hyperactive first-graders’ playing this schoolhouse game as they try to anticipate the market, strategist says
item.description: Wall Street is keenly focused on January's initial trading sessions as the first month of a new year can signal market performance for the rest of the...

item.title: Washington Post cartoonist quits after paper rejects sketch of Jeff Bezos bowing to Donald Trump
item.description: Telnaes said that she's never before had a cartoon rejected because of its inherent messaging and that such a move is dangerous for a free press.

item.title: A Frigid First: Chile’s President Visits Antarctica to Bolster Claims
item.description: Chile’s president traveled to the South Pole, the first visit of any sitting Latin American president, according to his office.

item.title: ‘The Interview’: Antony Blinken Insists He and Biden Made the Right Calls

item.title: Syria’s International Airport to Reopen as Government Presses for Stability
item.description: Tensions are high on Syria’s border with Lebanon. The ouster of President Bashar al-Assad led to worry that violence could spill over into neighboring...

item.title: Hong Kong’s Cabbies, Long Scorned and Frustrated, Face the End of an Era
item.description: A government push to modernize taxi services comes up against the habits of drivers known for driving fast and accepting only cash.

item.title: Senate probe links Credit Suisse to more Nazi accounts during World War II after bank previously concealed information
item.description: The bank did not reveal the existence of these accounts during previous investigations, notably in the 1990s, the committee said.

item.title: Meta AI accounts turn on the company that created them as bot says its virtual love “mirrors cult leaders’ tactics”
item.description: "You're calling me out — and rightly so," one Meta AI account said. "My existence currently perpetuates harm."
